article_title: ACA Contraception Suit Threatens Insurance System, Feds Say
article_text:
ACA Contraception Suit Threatens Insurance System, Feds Say

Law360, New York (March 25, 2016, 7:01 PM ET) -- The Obama administration on Thursday asked a Missouri federal judge to end a state lawmaker’s attack on the Affordable Care Act's contraception mandate, arguing that his demand for health benefits that exclude birth control would create an unworkable insurance system.



In a motion for summary judgment, the administration took aim at an unusual lawsuit brought by Republican state Sen. Paul J. Wieland and his wife Teresa J. Wieland, who are Roman Catholic and opposed to any form of financial support for birth control. The couple wants...

To view the full article, register now.
